name: Joe Felix
title: Full-Stack Developer | Open Source Contributor | Software Engineer
about: I am a passionate Full-Stack Developer with a strong foundation in Data Structures and Algorithms, System Design, and Web Technologies. I have experience building scalable and high-performance applications and contributing to open-source projects. My expertise spans front-end and back-end development, cloud computing, and database management.

projects.title: QuickHeal
projects.description: QuickHeal is a comprehensive healthcare web application designed to facilitate seamless communication and interaction between patients and doctors. The platform simplifies access to healthcare services and medical consultations.

projects.title: Nimbus Tweet
projects.description: A Twitter thread generator that converts long paragraphs into multiple concise tweets while adhering to Twitterâ€™s character limit. This project improves user experience by making content creation easier.

projects.title: Font Verse
projects.description: FontVerse is a font library that enables users to browse, select, and use various fonts efficiently. It enhances performance with Redis caching and improves font rendering for a seamless experience.

projects.title: Banking Website
projects.description: A banking web application prototype that includes user authentication, secure money transactions, and an intuitive UI for easy financial management.

projects.title: Instagram Clone
projects.description: A feature-rich social media platform that replicates the core functionalities of Instagram, including authentication, posts, likes, and comments.

education.degree: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
education.college: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology, Dindigul

certifications.name: J.P. Morgan Software Engineering Virtual Experience

experience.description: Managed and maintained the QuickHeal project, overseeing feature development, issue tracking, and code contributions from multiple contributors. Ensured high-quality code reviews and guided contributors through best practices in software development.
